greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts 4k+2 and 4k+3 with at least one part of each type.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000 (first 100 terms from Robert Price)
mathematica: nmax = 59; s1 = Range[0, nmax/4]*4 + 2; s2 = Range[0, nmax/4]*4 + 3;
x_ /; ContainsAny[x, s1 ] && ContainsAny[x, s2 ]], {n, 1, nmax}] (* _Robert Price_, Aug 06 2020 *)
nmax = 59; l = Rest@CoefficientList[Series[(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(4 k + 3)), {k, 0, nmax}])*(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(4 k + 2)), {k, 0, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x]  (* _Robert Price_, Aug 16 2020 *)
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
